node.title: Worst downhill day yet for Peloton stock
node.description: With gyms reopening after pandemic closures, Wall Street fears the race may be over for once-hot home-cycling business.

node.title: Jeopardy! Dodged a Bullet by Not Hiring 'Immunized' Aaron Rodgers as Host
node.description: The Green Bay Packers' quarterback now has to quarantine for 10 days, per the NFL's protocol, after testing positive for COVID.

node.title: Internet Backs Couple Who Received Heat From Neighbors for 'Reverse Trick-or-Treating'
node.description: The couple dressed up and went door-to-door to pass out candy and introduce themselves to their new neighbors.

node.title: When will Americans be able to get a COVID-19 antiviral pill?

node.title: Multiple Yale University Buildings Threatened With Bombs
node.description: The threats had targeted at least seven facilities across the Yale campus in New Haven, Connecticut.

node.title: Colin Powell remembered as a leader, father and friend at funeral
node.description: Former Secretary of State Colin Powell was the first Black American to hold that position and other high-ranking jobs in Washington.

node.title: U.N. Rights Panel Pressures Sudan Over Coup
node.description: The Human Rights Council appointed an expert to investigate abuses in the country since the military seized power on Oct. 25, and members called for the prime minister’s release.

node.title: Former Assistant AG Refuses to Answer Executive Privilege Questions From Jan. 6 Committee
node.description: Jeffrey Clark is just one former Trump official who has refused to answer questions from the committee investigating the January 6 Capitol insurrection.

node.title: NFL, Washington Football Team Should Lift Sexual Harassment Claim NDAs, Congress Says
node.description: More than a year ago, 15 former employees of the Washington Football Team made allegations of sexual harassment within the organization.

node.title: Stimulus Check Update: Petition for Monthly Checks Just 50K Signatures Shy of 3 Million
node.description: The petition calls for $2,000 checks to be sent out to Americans each month.

node.title: Newly-Elected Glenn Youngkin Pledged Bipartisanship But Will Face 'Democratic Alamo'

node.title: Kieran Crowley: 'It's going to be a good line in the sand for us'
node.description: Kieran Crowley continues to face a daunting challenge of transforming Italy's struggling rugby team.

node.title: Briscoe Group sales remain stable despite lockdowns

node.title: KiwiSaver third quarter returns relatively unaffected by lockdowns
node.description: KiwiSaver funds reflected subdued market conditions over the September quarter, with the bulk experiencing a return of less than one percent.

node.title: No, Kroger isn't accepting bitcoin as payment at its stores
node.description: News release posted on grocery chain's site claimed it now accepts Bitcoin Cash, but company says announcement is fake.

node.title: Cuomo arraignment delayed after DA rips "troubling" handling of case
node.description: Cuomo has denied the claim made in the complaint.

node.title: Defense lawyers portray the fatal shooting of Ahmaud Arbery as self-defense.
node.description: The lawyers represent Travis McMichael, who fatally shot Mr. Arbery, and his father. The lawyer for the third defendant deferred his opening statement until later in the trial.

node.title: Meet the Indigenous artist who helped design the 2023 Women's World Cup branding
node.description: Chern'ee Sutton, a Kalkadoon artist from Queensland, has designed the NRL's Indigenous All-Stars jersey, tennis trophies, and the 2018 Commonwealth Games mascot. Now, she's created art for one of football's biggest tournaments: the Women's World Cup.

node.title: Bones in the Backyard: How Police Cracked a Grisly Cold Case
node.description: George Seitz’s disappearance in 1976 drew little notice — until investigators found his skeleton in a backyard more than 40 years later.

node.title: Internet Slams Bride's Expensive 'Requests' After Bridesmaids 'Step Down' Due to Cost
node.description: "You have no right to spend other [folks'] money so freely. Friends don't put friends into debt," wrote one commenter on the bride's pricy demands.

node.title: Colin Powell Once Serenaded Foreign Official With Abba Song, Friend Recalls at Funeral
node.description: The longtime military man and civil servant had a well-known personal obsession with the Swedish pop band, one that was remembered at his funeral.

node.title: Net run rate to give cricket fans sore heads tonight, but a better tie breaker may be just over the rope
node.description: It may determine the T20 World Cup semi-finalists tonight, but fans can be forgiven for asking: How does net run rate work again?
